content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: RDOMAIN
      operator: equal_to_case_insensitive
      value: DM
    - name: QNAM
      operator: matches_regex
      value: (ENRFL|SAFFL|EFFFL|ITTFL|PPROTFL|COMPLFL|COMPLT|FULLSET|ITT|PPROT|SAFETY)
Core:
  Id: CORE-000211
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: SUPPDM must not include population flags.
Outcome:
  Message: Population flag is present in SUPPDM
  Output Variables:
    - QNAM
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0528
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: The standard Supplemental Qualifiers included in previous
                  versions of the SDTMIG (COMPLT, FULLSET, ITT, PPROT, and SAFETY)
                  should not be used. Note that the ADaM subject-level analysis dataset
                  (ADSL) specifies standard variable names for the most common populations
                  and requires the inclusion of these flags when necessary for analysis;
                  consult the ADaM Implementation Guide for more information about
                  these variables.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 5
                Section: '5.2'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SUPP--

json.Description: SUPPDM must not include population flags.

Outcome.Message: Population flag is present in SUPPDM

Citations.Cited_Guidance: The standard Supplemental Qualifiers included in previous versions of the SDTMIG (COMPLT, FULLSET, ITT, PPROT, and SAFETY) should not be used. Note that the ADaM subject-level analysis dataset (ADSL) specifies standard variable names for the most common populations and requires the inclusion of these flags when necessary for analysis; consult the ADaM Implementation Guide for more information about these variables.
